intro: Monactis calycifera, commonly known as the calycifera monactis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
